      • blockLenControl

        public static void blockLenControl​(char[] arr,
                                   int arrSize,
                                   int blockLen)
        This function controls the length of the blocks to be inserted. It is the first function of recursive function chain.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        arrSize - Array size Size of array
        blockLen - Length of block to be inserted Length of the current block to be inserted. Its current value is 3.

                                   int arrSize,
                                   int blockLen,
                                   int blockNum)

        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        arrSize - Array size
        blockLen - Length of block to be inserted
        blockNum - Number of blocks to be inserted. Its initial value is

      • startFromIndex

        public static void startFromIndex​(char[] arr,
                                  int arrSize,
                                  int blockLen,
                                  int blockNum,
                                  int startIndex)
        This function controls the starting index of the insertion to array. For example: -***-***- || --***-*** (Insertion is started in index 1 in first one, index 2 in second one.)
        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        arrSize - Array size
        blockLen - Length of block to be inserted
        blockNum - Number of blocks to be inserted.
        startIndex - Starting index of the insertion. Its initial value is 0.

      • currentBlockControl

        public static void currentBlockControl​(char[] arr,
                                       int arrSize,
                                       int blockLen,
                                       int blockNum,
                                       int curBlock,
                                       int startIndex,
                                       int callIndex)
        This function inserts required amount of blocks
        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        arrSize - Array size
        blockLen - Length of block to be inserted
        blockNum - Number of blocks to be inserted.
        curBlock - Current block that is being inserted. Its initial value is 0.
        startIndex - Starting index of insertion.
        callIndex - index that will be used to call next functions

      • insertInIndex

        public static void insertInIndex​(char[] arr,
                                 int arrSize,
                                 int blockLen,
                                 int blockNum,
                                 int curBlock,
                                 int index)
        This function tries inserting a block at the all next indexes possible while controlling current block value.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        arrSize - Array size
        blockLen - Length of block to be inserted
        blockNum - Number of blocks to be inserted.
        curBlock - Current block that is being inserted. Its initial value is 0.
        index - Index of the block to be inserted. Its initial value comes from startIndex function.

      • checkSpace

        public static boolean checkSpace​(char[] arr,
                                 int arrSize,
                                 int blockLen,
                                 int index,
                                 int count)
        This is helper function, it checks if this position is available for inserting a new block.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        arrSize - Array size
        blockLen - Length of block to be inserted
        index - Position to be checked.
        count - Count of encountered '-' characters.
        Returns:
        true if insertion available, false if not

      • checkIfPrintable

        public static boolean checkIfPrintable​(char[] arr,
                                       int arrSize,
                                       int index,
                                       int blockLen,
                                       int blockNum,
                                       int counter)
        This function checks if array is ready to be printed, in other words, all blocks are placed. It basically count number of painted cells and compares it with blockNum*blockLen.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        arrSize - Array size
        index -
        blockLen - Length of block to be inserted
        blockNum - Number of blocks to be inserted.
        counter - Counts number of '*' characters. Its initial value is 0
        Returns:

      • paintArr

        public static void paintArr​(char[] arr,
                            int startIndex,
                            int endIndex)
        This function paints between startIndex and endIndex with '*' character.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        index -
        endIndex -

      • findLastBlock

        public static int findLastBlock​(char[] arr,
                                int arrSize,
                                int index,
                                int blockLen,
                                int counter)
        This function finds the starting index of the last block placed. It counts number of '*' characters encountered and returns index when it's equal to blockLen.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array
        arrSize - Array size
        index - Index of array, its initial value is array size - 1
        blockLen - Length of block to be inserted
        Returns:
